page.title: 10HEALTH CARE IN LECHLADE
page.content: The{new medical centre}was opened in September 1982. It is a teaching practice. Drs. David and Sheila Stevens have a trainee doctor to help care for over 2,900 patients. A nurse is on duty each evening and there is a well equipped treatment room where stitches or injections are given. {Hospitals}in Swindon, Oxford and Cirencester serve this area. Two health visitors care for the elderly and young children. There is one full-time and one part-time district nurse in addition to a school doctor and school nurse.{Clinics }are held on Tuesdays and a{chiropodist}uses the centre. Two dentists practise in Lechlade and there is also a veterinary surgeon,{Mr. Baxter, who is {the third}generation to serve this area. He looks after farm and domestic animals.
